helpPage.title: Guides & troubleshooting
helpPage.subtitle: Learn how to configure PromptGen from registration to day-to-day operations.

quickStart.title: Quick start
quickStart.description: Three simple steps to get up and running.
items: Install the desktop app, sign in (or switch to offline mode) and land on the dashboard.
Follow the prompt to enter your model key; once you see the “connected” badge you’re ready to generate.
Click “New Prompt” to explore the workbench and how drafts are saved.

dashboard.title: Dashboard essentials
dashboard.description: See the metrics that matter at a glance.
items: Summary cards show total generations, drafts and success rate so you always know where you stand.
“Recent activity” lists the prompts you opened most recently; a soft highlight appears on hover.
Shortcut buttons on the cards take you straight back to unfinished work.

myPrompts.title: Managing My Prompts
myPrompts.description: Keep drafts and published prompts tidy.
items: Rows are sorted by last update; a gentle hover glow lets you confirm which prompt you’re about to open.
Each page shows 10 entries with pagination controls at the footer.
Export JSON backups anytime—deletes include a confirmation step to avoid mistakes.

publicPrompts.title: Explore the Public Prompt Library
publicPrompts.description: Browse curated community prompts and pull them into your workspace.
items: Use filters and search to quickly locate topics or languages.
The detail drawer lets you copy the full text or download into My Prompts.
Offline mode still lists curated entries; administrators can remove submissions.

workbench.title: Prompt Workbench tips
workbench.description: Shape keywords and drafts with confidence.
items: Enter a topic or natural-language brief and let AI suggest positive and negative keywords.
If you pause for around 10 seconds, the draft auto-saves so your edits are safe.
Manual saves and publish actions surface status toasts and record a new version.

settings.title: Settings & model management
settings.description: Control credentials and storage in one place.
items: Add or edit model credentials, then run a quick connectivity test before using them.
Use the data section to export JSON/CSV backups; the card shows when you last exported.
Moving to a new drive? Update the SQLite path here and restart the app.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
items: Seeing a duplicate-version warning when publishing? Update to the latest build and try again.
Workbench not responding in local mode? Make sure port 9090 isn’t occupied by another app.
Need more help? Reach us via the contacts below and attach your exported logs.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: Reach out whenever you need assistance.
items: Attach exported logs so we can trace issues quickly.
Let us know which OS/version you’re running when reporting bugs.
GitHub issues and PRs are welcome – we actively review them.

resources.title: Contact
resources.description: Discover community knowledge, source code, and support channels maintained by AB-IN.
resources.note: Questions or ideas? Open an issue or PR – contributions welcome.
